snippet: Internet mogul Xavier Niel believes his new college, called 42, will produce graduates who are more employable, but some educators criticize its nontraditional methods.
abstract: Telecommunications executive Xavier Niel founds technology academy, called 42, using unconventional model in which group projects take place of lectures and 'friendly organizers' replace instructors; Niel believes that his college will produce graduates who are more employable, but some educators criticize its nontraditional methods.
lead_paragraph: Internet mogul Xavier Niel believes his new college, called 42, will produce graduates who are more employable, but some educators criticize its nontraditional methods.

headline.main: A Computer Academy in France Defies Conventional Wisdom
headline.print_headline: A Computer Academy in France Defies Conventional Wisdom
